title: Alphabets and Sounds
content: Pupils learn the 26 letters of the alphabet (A–Z) and the sounds they make. Practice by singing the alphabet song.

title: Simple Words
content: Children learn to form and read small words using letters and sounds.

title: Basic Spelling Rules
content: Pupils are introduced to simple spelling rules such as adding 's' for plurals or 'ing' for action words.

title: Rhyming Words
content: Rhyming words sound alike, especially at the end. They make learning fun and improve listening skills.

title: Compound Words
content: Compound words are formed by joining two words together to make a new meaning.

title: Synonyms
content: Synonyms are words that have the same or nearly the same meaning.

title: Antonyms
content: Antonyms are words that mean the opposite of each other.

title: Homophones
content: Homophones are words that sound the same but have different meanings and spellings.

title: Prefixes and Suffixes
content: Pupils learn how adding parts to the beginning or end of words changes their meaning.

title: Vocabulary Building
content: Children learn new words, their meanings, and how to use them in sentences to improve communication.
